titleStmt.title: W. A. Nichols, Special Orders, No. 173
CWG14278

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 7

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, April 17th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 173. }
(Extract.)

39. Leave of absence for thirty days is hereby granted the following officers, paroled Prisoners of War, at the expiration of which they will report in person to the Commanding Officer of Camp Parole nearest the Department or Army in which their regiments may be serving: --

By order of the Secretary of War:
W. A. NICHOLS,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
Saml Breck
Assistant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
English Duvall
Maj
Order granting him 30 days leave of absence at the expiration of which time he will report in person to the Commanding Officer of Camp of Parole nearest where his Regiment may be serving
Recd A. G. O. April 24. 1865
